fields.name: James Patterson
fields.bio: James Patterson is an American author known for his thriller novels and collaborations with various co-authors.

fields.name: J.K. Rowling
fields.bio: British author best known for creating the Harry Potter fantasy series.

fields.name: Stephen King
fields.bio: American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, crime, science-fiction, and fantasy novels.

fields.name: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
fields.bio: Nigerian writer whose works range from novels to short stories to nonfiction.

fields.name: Haruki Murakami
fields.bio: Japanese writer known for his surrealistic and dreamlike novels and short stories.

fields.name: Margaret Atwood
fields.bio: Canadian poet, novelist, literary critic, essayist, teacher, environmental activist, and inventor.

fields.name: Yuval Noah Harari
fields.bio: Israeli public intellectual, historian and professor known for his books on evolution and history.

fields.name: Neil Gaiman
fields.bio: English author of short fiction, novels, comic books, graphic novels, nonfiction, audio theatre, and films.

fields.name: Michelle Obama
fields.bio: American attorney and author who served as the First Lady of the United States from 2009 to 2017.

fields.name: Tara Westover
fields.bio: American memoirist, essayist and historian known for her memoir Educated.

fields.title: The Midnight Club
fields.story: A thrilling mystery set in a remote mountain lodge where five strangers become trapped during a snowstorm, only to discover that one of them is a killer.

fields.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
fields.story: The story of a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday, when he receives a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

fields.title: The Shining
fields.story: The story follows Jack Torrance, his wife Wendy, and their five-year-old son Danny, who move into the Overlook Hotel in the Colorado Rockies.

fields.title: Americanah
fields.story: A story of a young Nigerian woman, Ifemelu, who immigrates to the United States to attend university.

fields.title: Norwegian Wood
fields.story: A nostalgic story of loss and burgeoning sexuality set in Tokyo during the late 1960s.

fields.title: The Handmaid's Tale
fields.story: Set in a near-future New England, in a totalitarian state resembling a theonomy that overthrows the United States government.

fields.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
fields.story: A book that explores the development of Homo sapiens from prehistoric times to the present day.

fields.title: American Gods
fields.story: A blend of Americana, fantasy, and various strands of ancient and modern mythology.

fields.title: Becoming
fields.story: A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States Michelle Obama.

fields.title: Educated
fields.story: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

fields.title: Cross Fire
fields.story: Detective Alex Cross faces his most terrifying opponent yet: a genius serial killer who targets his family.

fields.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
fields.story: Harry's second year at Hogwarts is even more exciting and dangerous than his first, with a mysterious Chamber of Secrets being opened.

fields.title: It
fields.story: The story follows the experiences of seven children as they are terrorized by an evil entity that exploits the fears of its victims.

fields.title: Purple Hibiscus
fields.story: A coming of age story set in postcolonial Nigeria during the military coup of the 1990s.

fields.title: Kafka on the Shore
fields.story: A metaphysical journey that blends dreams, myths, and reality with two intertwined narratives.

fields.title: The Testaments
fields.story: Set 15 years after the events of The Handmaid's Tale, the novel is narrated by Aunt Lydia, a character from the previous novel.

fields.title: Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow
fields.story: An exploration of the dreams and nightmares that will shape the twenty-first century.

fields.title: Neverwhere
fields.story: The story of Richard Mayhew and his odyssey through London Below, a magical realm coexisting with the London we know.

fields.title: The Light We Carry
fields.story: Michelle Obama offers readers a series of fresh stories and insightful reflections on change, challenge, and power.

fields.title: Collaborative Fiction
fields.story: A unique collaboration between Patterson and Gaiman, blending thriller elements with fantasy to create an unprecedented reading experience.
